GeneralInformation.History: Created 2005, acquired status 2012. Apollos University is a distance education university that was previously located in California, and moved to Montana in 2016.
AdmissionRequirements: Master's programme: a reconised undergraduate degree;undergraduate GPA of 2
0 scale); Doctoral programme: master's degree from a recognized institution; graduate GPA of 3

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1893 as Agricultural College of the State of Montana, and acquired present title 1965. A Land-Grant institution.
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1927 as Eastern Montana Normal School. Affiliated with Montana State University and acquired present title 1994.
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination
Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination

GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to May (August-December; January-May). Also Summer Session (May-July)
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1893 as Normal School, acquired present title 1965. A Branch Campus of the University of Montana. A State institution.
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination

GeneralInformation.History:
Founded 1932 as Normal School, became Great Falls College of Education 1949, and College of Great Falls 1952. Became University of Great Falls, 1995.
Acquired present title 2017. A private institution affiliated with the Sisters of Providence (Roman Catholic Church).
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to May. Also Summer Session (May-August)
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent
